nodes.bodyText:
Recording of the root of the tree will need to be moved out of this method, having it here is resulting in each container being recorded and counted twice since they are also recorded in the loop of members below. For example, i got this event:
                "Objects destroyed: b10608f7-3aad-44d0-83a5-07e4a3b41844
3b66b013-b3c1-4bd7-a7eb-81ab30afc36b
3b66b013-b3c1-4bd7-a7eb-81ab30afc36b
c532a45c-647d-4425-a5e8-a8f11133e43e
c532a45c-647d-4425-a5e8-a8f11133e43e
bb8949d0-283b-47ee-82b5-a32346c97481
bb8949d0-283b-47ee-82b5-a32346c97481" , "7 object(s) were destroyed" ;

You can see 3b66b013-b3c1-4bd7-a7eb-81ab30afc36b in the list multiple times, since its is both the root of a tree and a member
Could you update DestroyObjectsJobIT to check for an event being added to the parent? You should be able to check that the right number of objects are destroyed at least
there should probably be a newline after the colon so that all the ids have their own line

commit.message: Move root count out of loop and update tests.

nodes.bodyText:
Remove the space before {0} so that all of the entries have the same indentation.
Also, for the sake of consistency you should use System.getProperty("line.separator") here too. You're welcome to it in a variable if you want to shorten things, etiher way is fine.
i think you can remove this variable and just call deletedObjIds.size()
its still putting a space in front of the first entry but not the following ones. You can just remove the leading space here

sorry, this isn't quite what i meant. You should be able to delete this variable and all the places it gets incremented, and then when you generate the premis event call deletedObjIds.size() to get the number of ids
